abstract.p: Peter J Riga calls for heavier penalties on baseball players who start or join in brawls

block.p: I just don't understand the penalties of the baseball commissioner. Players make millions of dollars a year, so what can an eight-game or even a 15-game suspension mean? It means that some guy that year will make $7.1 million rather than $7.6 million. Some punishment.

If baseball is serious about avoiding such vicious fights as happened between the Detroit Tigers and the Chicago White Sox, what it needs to do is suspend without pay for a whole season those who start the fight and half a season or 40 games, whichever is more, for those who join in. That will hurt in the only way that will control their behavior.

If any player knows that if he throws the first punch, he is out for the season (or more), he will control himself. There is a difference between $7.1 million and $0. Even a baseball player can compare those figures.
